definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: And so, each hydrogen has access to each electron, and now we have a satisfied system.
sentences.chinese: 每个氢原子都有两个电子，这是一个令人满意的体系。

sentences.english: Now here are these two isolated hydrogen atoms.
sentences.chinese: 现在这是两个分别独立的氢原子。

sentences.english: This is for atomic hydrogen gas.
sentences.chinese: 但这只是针对气态氢原子的情况。

sentences.english: H atom is charged negatively in chemisorption.
sentences.chinese: 在化学吸附过程中，氢原子被带上负电。

sentences.english: All this happened inside a magnetic bottle that traps the antihydrogen atoms.
sentences.chinese: 这一切都发生在一个俘获反氢原子的磁瓶里。

sentences.english: As is known to all, water is composed of two hydrogens and one oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，水是由两个氢原子和一个氧原子构成的。

sentences.english: Both hydrogens are going to share equally.
sentences.chinese: 两个氢原子将平分能量。

sentences.english: The carbon atoms in the plastic are saturated, having bonded with two hydrogen atoms.
sentences.chinese: 塑料中的碳原子呈饱和态，与两个氢原子相结合。

sentences.english: But what ionizes the hydrogen atoms?
sentences.chinese: 那么，又是什么电离的氢原子呢？

sentences.english: That is the electron in its lowest orbit, to the nucleus of atomic hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 那就是氢原子原子核外电子，最低轨道到情况。

sentences.english: That is the ground state energy of atomic hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 同时也是氢原子基态的能量值。

sentences.english: Suppose we look at elemental hydrogen.
So there's one electron in each hydrogen atom.
sentences.chinese: 所以每个氢原子中有两个电子。

sentences.english: The hydrogen atoms get kicked out, and carbon atoms form bonds with other carbon atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氢原子被踢出来，碳原子之间相互结合。

sentences.english: So we are going to put atomic hydrogen Z equals one, 1 ground state n equals one.
sentences.chinese: 氢原子Z等于，基态n也等于。
